text: no Dead Kennedys reference in the comment.. but they are the band which drew my attention to Penis Landscape. Oh how i love controversial bands and controvertsial artwork, however probably badly spelled. Also, thank you, kind sir!

text: puppies are way cute.

text: No wonder there are so many puppyists.

name: pogo
text: He has history with the first round of clowns to discover this sandbox, where he apparently pooped a lot.

name: delzhand
text: Ray totally thinks that Roast Beef would use Internet Explorer.

name: jthm_guitarist
text: Exactly, Beef is more computer savvy than that.

name: unsentletter
text: No way in hell he'd use IE except to debug. Y'all are so correct -- it's all in Ray's mind...

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
IE is the only browser Ray knows about.

and that, for him, is okay. 'sides, if any virus ever attacked his machine, he'd straight-up huck it and get a new one.

name: load_blown
text: i would chubbie a second if allowed for

text: hahahaha...hahahaha... There is no comment besides laughter.

text: This one always cracks me up, I love the parody so much. I wonder if Vlad backspaced or zoomed?

oh well, can't please everybody

text: I'm not Mormon but I lamed it for being such a bad joke.  I do live in Utah though... so maybe I've just heard it waaaaaayyyyyy too many times.

text: Man this mainly just makes me want a Subway sandwich...

name: honesttom
text: Sex sells!

name: ringwoodcomics
text: Don't saythings like that, Phillipe.

name: molesticide
text:
i'm eating one right now! i must have gotten it last night, but i don't remember... there's only half of it left. i had to pull off the tomatoes.

deLICious.

name: saru
text:
So let me get this straight. You are eating a sandwich that you do not remember purchasing, and has ingredients on it that you do not like.
You... I hate to point out the obvious, but, did you just steal my sandwich?

name: bourbonsamurai
text: That comment made me laugh out loud. And then try to think of some witty sandwich related comment to add but fail because I have been drinking.

name: tourach3
text: I AM A BOURBON SAMURAI AT MOMENTS SUCH AS THIS VERY ONE

text:
you should take an interest in sandwiches
(or sammiches)
try joining club sandwich


...i wish i had a jam sammich

name: heccibiggs
text: Hahaha you're a genius

name: semiquaver
text: Comments like these prove that when Onstad does a three-panel, the rest of us crave to add more witty flavor.  There is nae better comic.

name: direhaggis
text: The lapels of Beef's coat are curious.

name: pitseleh
text:
It's a pretty solid parody of the cover for the movie Say Anything.

[IMGS OFF]

text: No, early morning.  Just around dawn...I mean...erm...I dunno?

text: Ehh. I'd vote for someone more morose-looking. Off the top of my head... Ed Norton after a whiskey bender?

text: So does Craig Schwartz. John Cusack. Whatever his name is.

name: charchar
text:
Malkovich. Malkovich Malkovich Malkovich.

Malkovich? Malkovich, Malkovich.

name: stuart
text: Molly really hates having better jobs suggested to her.

name: caseyb3
text: 'Is Mormon?' has been my preferred way of asking any question even vaguely associated with Mormons since I saw this. Is so goot.

name: direhaggis
text: Roast Beef is wearing pants in Ray's mind. It's kinda shocking. No one really wears pants in Achewood.

name: heccibiggs
text:
Disagreement box!

Philippe's trousers are a staple of Achewood. And what about Teodor's crazy things? And pretty much all the characters tend to wear trousers at least occasionally.

Or, "pants", whatever.

name: direhaggis
text: Shorts and pantaloons, respectively--respectfully.

name: atticusonline
text:
you and your disagreement boxes

haha solid chubby

text: Roast Beef always struck me as a guy who switches between firefox and lynx, depending on his needs.

text: Rock on, Beef.   Rock on untill the end of days, with that laptop and coat.

text: The alt-text has found my new wave guy! I was wonderingb where he was.

text: I can't believe I was all like "holy shit its that john cusack movie from the 80s.  man the 80s rocked for movies."

text: Any comic featuring references to "Say Anything" automatically win, even if they suck. And this one does it without sucking.
